reviewText: I personally think that over the edge wasnt so good. I didnt really like it not only cause one of my favorite superstars fell but didnt die til he got on his way 2 the hospital. thats one thing people keep messing up. the man didnt die in the ring. but anyways the matches wasnt as i expected. to tell u the truth i was 2 upset 2 see them but i did. and far as i seen the best match that night was triple h vs the rock in a leather strap match but the last match wasnt worth the money. all it was was a repeat of summerslam 98 match between austin and undertaker. but this tape cant be faunt anywhere cause or the tragidee of the late owen hart. u will never find the tape and box. only way u couldnt seen it is if u have ordered it as myself on pay per view that night.  12/12/02

reviewText: First of all, I just want to point out that this event is not the event that happened in 1999 but it was the one that happened in 1998. However, since most fans here have wrote separate reviews about both events, I'll do one better & review both events since I have seen them both. It should be noted though that Over The Edge 1999 was never OFFICIALLY released by the WWF due to the tragic accident that occurred that night.Over The Edge '98- This event was highlighted by the main event in which WWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin had the odds against him in ways that have never occurred before as he was prepared for a rematch with Dude Love with the twist being that Vince McMahon will be the guest referee, Pat Patterson will be the ring announcer & Gerald Brisco will be the timekeeper. Also, the feud between the Nation & DX was picking up some steam here as Owen Hart joined the Nation to take out DX while Marc Mero vowed to get rid of Sable.L.O.D. 2000 vs D.O.A. The beginning of the feud between these two teams along with Droz being added to the group to start the tease of tension between Droz & Hawk. This was just like all of their series of matches during this feud as the match was dull & boring with the only noteworthy moment being Sunny as she was quite the sight at ringside.Right around here was when the Intercontinental Champion The Rock came out to cut a promo but was attacked by Faarooq that lead to Rock being carried out on a stretcher.Jeff Jarrett vs Steve Blackman. At least this match was better than the opener as they had a good match here but there was nothing special or memorable here.Marc Mero vs Sable. The situation here was that Mero agreed to face anyone that Sable had choosen with the stipulation being that if Sable's representative won, then she would be free from Mero while if Mero wins, Sable has to leave the WWF. This was really just a segment that could have been saved for RAW as Mero tricked Sable to get the quick pinfall victory.Handicap Match: Bradshaw & Taka Michinoku vs Kaientai. A bonus match with the only real buildup being the feud between Taka & Kaientai that went back to not only their Japanese Pro Wrestling days but also their ECW run. A good match as Taka & the three members of Kaientai (one of them being Funaki, Taka's future partner) worked well together with mat wrestling & high-flying while the three ran whenever Bradshaw got involved during the match to the point where Bradshaw overpowered them when he was in the ring.Intercontinental Champion The Rock vs Faarooq. For all the build up between these two (as for those that don't remember was when The Rock took over as the leader of the Nation), this was not a great match as their styles just didn't mesh well here to the point where the match came off sloppy instead of crisp. This was just continuing the storyline with the Nation & DX as they made an appearance after the match.Mask vs Mask: Kane vs Vader. The loser of the match would have to unmask, which was sort of pointless since we can see Vader's face but anyways, this was an average match that again was nothing special or memorable but it was better than a lot of the matches that have been on the card before it.D-Generation X vs The Nation. The representing members for DX during this match were Triple H & New Age Outlaws while the Nation's representatives were Owen Hart, D'Lo Brown & Kama. This was a nice six man tag with everyone getting a chance to shine during the match as again, it continued the Nation/DX feud but at the same time, continued the HHH/Owen feud to the point where Owen got the win by using the pedigree on Triple H onto the tag belt.WWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin vs Dude Love w/Special Referee Vince McMahon, Special Timekeeper Gerald Brisco & Ring Announcer Pat Patterson. Mick Foley stated on his DVD set that this was his favorite match as Dude Love & it's obvious why because this was the best match of the Dude Love character. This was just a wild brawl with the McMahon, Patterson & Brisco changing the rules as the match goes on with moments like Dude's fall off of the railing to the concrete floor, Austin being thrown from one car to another, Dude's leap off the car, Austin being heavily busted open along with Undertaker making a cameo to chokeslam Patterson & Brisco through the announce tables.Overall, this was a one match show as the most memorable match on this event is the main event but since this match has been released onto two DVD sets, I would just get one of those DVDs (both are Mick Foley's sets) because this event is really forgettable.Over The Edge '99- This is the second & last Over The Edge event with WWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin once again defending his title in a situation where the odds are against him. This time, it's against The Undertaker with Shane McMahon being the special referee. Unfortunately, this was the event where Owen Hart was involved in a tragic accident that ended his life to the point that WWF has never released any footage of this event.WWF Tag Team Champions Kane & X-Pac vs D'Lo Brown & Mark Henry. Great tag team match along with this being one of Mark Henry's best performances throughout his career (and trust me, there weren't many) along with everyone else working well together as D'Lo/Pac have shown in their series during their feud in 1998 with Kane pulling off some surprise offense as well including doing some high-flying moves at one point.Hardcore Champion Al Snow vs Hardcore Holly. Their final match in their series as they followed the same pattern as their previous matches with this being a brawl all over the arena using various weapons like a table, trash cans etc... with one moment being both fighting in the lobby, using popcorn & even going into the woman's bathroom.Unfortunately, this was when the tragedy happened as The Blue Blazer (Owen Hart) was scheduled to face Intercontinental Champion The Godfather but the match never happened as Owen fell from the ceiling. RIP Owen, We Miss You Buddy.Val Venis & Nicole Bass vs Jeff Jarrett & Debra. For the most part, this was more like Venis vs Jarrett featuring Debra & Bass because they were barely in the match if at all. This match was nothing special as the only highlight here being the aftermath.Road Dogg vs Billy Gunn. The explosion of the New Age Outlaws but for all the hype, this match was a disappointment. Billy Gunn was a better tag team wrestler than he was a singles while Dogg was just a decent wrestler but their styles didn't mesh well here & I just found the match to be very lackluster for the most part.Elimination Match: Mankind, Test, Ken Shamrock & Big Show vs Big Bossman, Viscera & Acolytes. For those that don't remember, this was during the Union angle as the former Corporation members teamed up to take on the Corporate Ministry. This was a better match than anyone expected as the eliminations made the match better than what it would have been. It was nothing special but it was watchable for what it was.The Rock vs Triple H. This is one of their forgotten matches as this match gets overshadowed by their more memorable encounters. The issue here was that Rock had an injured arm going into the match due to Triple H's attack weeks before on RAW. These two have never had a bad match & this was no exception with Triple H being very aggressive here as he focused on Rock's arm with Chyna getting involved from time to time. The ending was kinda of a jip but the aftermath made up for it as they continued to battle with Mankind having a cameo in the end.WWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin vs The Undertaker w/Special Referees Vince & Shane McMahon. Don't let the title fool you as Vince was taken out earlier on Heat & didn't make an appearance until the end. Just like Rock/HHH, this was a forgotten match that gets heavily overshadowed by their more famous encounters. A great match between these two as this was one of their more unique performances as both worked on each other's leg before the wrestling match became a brawl with Shane getting involved including some hilarious moments where he tries to help Taker. With cameos from Pat Patterson, Gerald Brisco & McMahon in the end, this was a great main event that ranks up with their SummerSlam match as their best "wrestling" match.Overall, this event is mostly remembered for the wrong reasons but the highlights of this show were easily forgotten about the best quality matches involving those participants are available elsewhere.

reviewText: This Pay Per View & The Survivor Series 1997 have 2 things in common 1 I don't want to talk about the controversial issue the show is known for & 2 they both deal with men with the last name Hart. Owen Hart died in a horrible way I remember hearing about the death of Owen Hart when 13 I was eating breakfast how he died in a stunt cause he was in his Blue Blazer character & he was going to defeat The Godfather to win The WWF Intercontinental title for the 3rd time. I think he was going to go on to work with Stone Cold Steve Austin that summer I have heard that Owen was going to get the nick name "The Game" Hart was killed when the harness he was being lowered from the rafters he was going to have a goofy entrance cause that was The Blue Blazer's character. Their is no footage only what's in the vault in WWE Headquarters, what The Kansas City PD got & Martha Hart Owen's Wife was given. I am not going into all the lawsuits that's gone on I just hope 1 day Martha will allow Owen to go into The WWE Hall Of Fame. Owen worked The Blue Blazer cause he didn't want to work a program with Jeff Jarrett where they would be fighting over Debra. I guess he didn't want to cause he didn't want to sent the wrong message to his Son which is understandable. I guess Vince Russo gave him this which Owen was afraid of heights so I really wish Owen would've spoke up & said he couldn't do it cause he was afraid of heights. & no Vince Russo didn't kill Owen Hart that's what Jim Cornette says but Jim Cornette to me has became a sad little man & a mean spirited prick. I have lost all respect for him lately. So now I'll talk about the events leading into this Pay Per View the night after Backlash Vince McMahon was going to have control of The WWF given to The Undertaker for his Daughter's return The Undertaker wanted Stone Cold Steve Austin to bring the documents. Vince McMahon tried to get Austin to do it but he told him to kiss his @  *  *. McMahon went to meet The Undertaker but The Undertaker showed up at the arena he was going to Marry Stephanie McMahon in a Satanic Wedding. Ken Shamrock & The Big Show tried to save Stephanie but were laid out. Stone Cold came out & cleared the ring of The Ministry Of Darkness & saved Stephanie. I covered this episode RAW on here on The Pro Wrestling Forum as well as The Smackdown Special that got a good enough rating to become a regular show for The WWF that August. On The Smackdown Special Shane McMahon formed The Corporate Ministry. On the following Heat Shane McMahon made a match for Over The Edge for Austin to defend The WWF title against The Undertaker & Shane made himself The Special Guest Referee. On The May 10th episode of RAW IS WAR WWF Commissioner Shawn Michaels added Vince McMahon as a Special Guest Referee. The next week on RAW IS WAR Shane McMahon made a stipulation for the title match if Austin touches him or breaths on him he will disqualify Austin strip him of the title & give the title to The Undertaker. Later on that night Austin took on Triple H & The Undertaker came out he was going to put Austin on his cross symbol you had The UNION group come out help & Austin put The Undertaker on his own cross symbol. The cross symbol was being raised & The Undertaker was laughing as the show closed. On The April 26th episode of RAW IS WAR The Rock cut a promo on Shane McMahon about how he screwed up during his match with Austin the night before at Backlash. Shane McMahon came out & they had words he was attacked by The Corporation & kicked out The Rock challenged Shane McMahon for later in the night. The Rock owned Shane McMahon but Triple H & Chyna came out & jumped The Rock. Triple H wanted The Rock so on the following Heat Shane McMahon made Triple H vs The Rock at Over The Edge. The next night on RAW IS WAR Triple H threw The Rock off the stage & The Rock's arm was broken. On The May 16th episode of Sunday Night Heat Shane McMahon demanded that The Rock take his cast off for his match at Over The Edge cause The Rock had been using it as weapon & he put The Rock in a Casket Match against The Undertaker for the next night on RAW & the following night on RAW IS WAR Triple H came out with a Sledge Hammer he took it & hit The Rock's broken arm The Undertaker put The Rock in The Casket & they locked him in it then Triple H took a Sledge Hammer & continually bashed in The Casket with it. The Rock was just a mess. On The Smackdown Special The New Age Outlaws lost to The WWF Tag Team Champions Kane & X Pac Billy Gunn went into X Pac's Locker Room & started beating on him. On The Following Sunday Night Heat it looked like their problems were over & DX was going to continue but Billy Gunn beat up X Pac & Road Dogg Jesse James & BA Billy Gunn were headed for a showdown. On The April 25th episode of Sunday Night Heat Nicole Bass helped Val Venis in a tag team match she told him that he owes her & that she wanted Val Venis. But Val Venis had his eyes on Debra. On The May 3rd episode of RAW IS WAR Debra was suppose to be in a Evening Gown Match against Sable but she wasn't there so she sent Nicole Bass in her place & she was ready to destroy Debra but Jeff Jarrett blasted Nicole Bass with a guitar. Val Venis carried Debra off but Jarrett got Val Venis too. The next week on RAW IS WAR Jeff Jarrett defeated Val Venis with the help of Debra also Debra won The WWF Women's title. The following Heat Val Venis & Nicole Bass agreed to team up against Jeff Jarrett & Debra at Over The Edge. On The May 3rd episode of RAW IS WAR Mankind, Ken Shamrock, Test & The Big Show formed The UNION. On The April 26th episode of RAW IS WAR Hardcore Holly beat up Al Snow & took Head until & he said he wouldn't give it back until he gave him a rematch for The Hardcore title. On The following Heat Al Snow told Hardcore Holly that Head is The Hardcore Champion. So the next week on Heat Al Snow had a match against Head & he had this Deer Head that he used as a replacement & he took it & pinned Head he had The Deer Head underneath so now The Deer Head was Hardcore Champion. The next week on Heat Hardcore Holly took The Deer Head & busted it up. The next night on RAW IS WAR Al Snow said since his Deer Head was busted it up he will go on as The Hardcore Champion & he will defend the title against Hardcore Holly against at Over The Edge. Those were the stories going on leading into this show. The buyrate was a 1.24 that is a huge improvement from Over The Edge 98 which got a 0.65.The champions at the time wereWWF Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin March 28th 1999WWF Intercontinental Champion The Godfather April 12th 1999WWF Tag Team Champions X Pac & Kane March 30th 1999 match aired April 5th 1999WWF Hardcore Champion Al Snow April 25th 1999WWF Women's Champion Debra May 10th 1999Date May 23, 1999Attendance 16,472Venue Kemper ArenaCity Kansas City, MissouriHeatThe Corporate Ministry came out.Shane McMahon gave a reminder that if Austin lays 1 hand on him he will strip Austin of The WWF title & will give it to The Undertaker. He then said he has a shoulder injury that prevents him from counting to 3 so he needs a warm up he put Stone Cold in a match against Mideon & made himself The Special Guest Referee for that match. He said he has 1 h  *  *  l of a night ahead of him.Vince McMahon arrived to the arena. They showed what happened to during the break where Howard Finkel told McMahon that Shane put Stone Cold in a match against Mideon on Heat.Meat aka generic Sean Stasiak with P M S Def Brian Christopher with Scott Taylor DUDMichael Hayes & The Hardy Boyz attacked Too Much after the match.Vince McMahon called out Shane he told him there will be no match between Stone Cold & Mideon. Shane said that he calls the shots & said that if Austin doesn't show then he will strip him of the title on Heat & will give the title to The Undertaker. Shane then came up with an idea of Vince facing Mideon on Heat Vince agreed to it.The Rock arrived at the arena.They showed a really good video package for The Rock vs Triple H match.The Rock came outHe said he is going to rip Triple H's heart out. He added that Triple H has found his way into The Smackdown Hotel The Rock said he is going to have dinner at The Candy @  *  * Cafe. He's going to have a Rock Burger with extra Rock Sauce.Triple H interrupted & appeared on The Titan Tron he said that The Rock better lose the cast or he will lose it for him.They show Vince McMahon getting ready for his match with Mideon.This guy named Lucas chatted with Michael Hayes & The Hardy Boyz.The Hardy Boyz Matt & Jeff with Michael PS Hayes Def Goldust & The Blue Meanie * & half of a starThe Brood gave Hayes & The Hardy's a blood bath.A decent video package was shown for The UNION vs Corporate Ministry match.That Lucas guy interviewed The UNION The Big Boss Man parked a For Lift in front of The Union's Locker Room  blocking them from getting out.Mideon with The Corporate Ministry vs Vince McMahon with Patterson & Brisco went to a no contest DUDShane McMahon was The Special Guest RefereeThe Corporate Ministry ganged up on Vince they also injured his leg.Austin arrived at the arena.Then we get to The Pay Per View.You have a really good openingWWF Tag Team ChampionshipChampions X Pac & Kane Def Mark Henry & D'Lo Brown with Ivory. ** & 3 quarters of a stara more than decent match.Michael Cole in the back said that Vince McMahon might have broken his ankle & may not be able to be The 2nd Special Guest Referee.Kevin Kelly interviewed Hardcore Holly he told a story when he was a kid that he had an imaginary friend named Little Joe he said he's going to peel Al Snow's head open.WWF Hardcore ChampionshipChampion Al Snow Def Hardcore Holly *Typical Hardcore title match  could've knocked off 5 minutes & it wouldn't have made a difference.Michael Cole talked to Patterson & Brisco & they said there's an ambulance on the way.Now we get to the most infamous part of the show Owen Hart feel to his death the people at home didn't see which I am glad we didn't the people in the arena did Jim Ross said that there's big problems. Jim Ross explains to us that this is real not part of any angle. The rest of this show is let's get through tonight.Jerry Lawler said that it doesn't look good at all.Kevin Kelly interviewed Jeff Jarrett & Debra it was emotional for Double J cause he & Owen were friends.Mixed Tag Team MatchVal Venis & Nicole Bass Def Jeff Jarrett & Debra * & quarter of a starNicole Bass kissed Val Venis a kiss which he liked.In the back Vince McMahon was being sent to the hospital for real cause of Owen Hart.Shane McMahon showed up & promised to be a "impartial" Referee.a good video package was show for The Road Dogg vs Billy Gunn match.Kevin Kelly interview The Road Dogg which Road Dogg had some kind words for Owen Hart.BA Billy Gunn Def Road Dogg Jesse James * & half of a stara ad for King Of The Ring was shown that was pretty good.Michael Cole interviewed Shane McMahon.Shane said it is not his fault that Vince's angle is injured & he will count the title match right down the middle.8 Man Tag Team Match Survivor Series RulesThe UNIONThe Big ShowMankindTest & Ken ShamrockDefThe Corporate MinistryFaarooq, BradshawBig Boss Man& VisceraBradshaw eliminated TestKen Shamrock eliminated BradshawKen Shamrock was eliminated when he attacked a Referee & not letting go of The Ankle Lock when Faarooq had his hands on the ropes.Big Show eliminated FaarooqBig Show & Viscera fought their way to the back so I guess that counts as an eliminationMankind eliminated The Big Boss Man **Then Jim Ross had the horrible & awful duty to tell us that Owen Hart is dead.Then they show a really good video package for The Rock vs Triple H matchKevin Kelly interviewed The Rock before he could say anything he was attacked by Triple H he tried to cut off The Rock's cast but Mankind made the save. Chyna distracted Mankind HHH hit Mankind with a lead pipe.The Rock Def Triple H with Chyna by disqualification ** & half of a stardecent match not given enough time & Owen's death was on their mind Triple H worked on the "broken arm" of The Rock. The Rock did an alright job selling it. The Rock beat up HHH pretty good after the match. Chyna distracted The Rock Triple H took a chair to The Rock's "broken arm"Mankind came out & chased HHH & Chyna off.Another really good video package was shown for The WWF title matchWWF ChampionshipUndertaker with Paul Bearer Def Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin **** to regain the titleVince & Shane McMahon were The Guest Referee'sVince returned late in the match Shane ran Vince into Austin Undertaker got the pin & Shane gave a fast count.A great match to a rather depressing Pay Per View.This show was decent I mean the match between Triple H & The Rock was decent. More than decent Tag Team title match with X Pac & Kane vs D'Lo Brown & Mark Henry. Undertaker & Stone Cold had a great match The UNION vs The Corporate Ministry was ok. Basically it's just a decent Pay Per View with Owen Hart's death really dragging the show down. I know some people like to get on their soap box & complain they should've stopped the show. Maybe they should maybe they shouldn't but there's not much you can do about a show from 15 years ago. Everyone who worked with Owen loved this man he was a huge loss to wrestling & from what I have heard about him personally Owen Hart was a loss to humanity & going back & watch Owen compete I am a fan of his now & he was gone too soon he is still missed.
summary: RIP Owen James Hart gone 15 years gone too soon Over The Edge 1999 review 6.5/10
Title: N/A

reviewText: Overall this was a decent event, considering what occured here. In this event Owen Hart had an accident where he fell from the ceiling to the ring and sadly died because of that. When this happened it was really sad, and made it just a little hard to watch the rest of the matches. In the video, you do not see Owen fall or see him lying in the ring with the people attending him (which is a little better than having to see someone almost dead in the ring). Owen was scheduled to wrestle The Godfather for the Intercontinental Title after the Al Snow and Hardcore Holly match. The matches continued after his fall and it was announced that Owen Hart died after the good 8-Man tag match. I give a lot of credit to the commentators and the wrestlers that came out to perform after Owen's fall because I am sure they felt really sad. So in the end the wrestlers did put on a good show. I give a thanks to Owen for memories. Here are the matches.1. X-Pac and Kane vs. D-Lo Brown and Mark Henry with Ivory 8/10This was a decent opener. This match had a whole lot of good moves coming from all men. It was also kind of funny how X-Pac got beat up here. Nice finish when Kane chokeslams Henry to retain the WWE Tag Team Titles. It wen a little slow but the good moves saved it.2. Hardcore Holly vs. Al Snow 8/10This was a good Hardcore Match. It is definetly not better than the matches these two had at WWE St. Valentine's Day Massacre or WWE Backlash 1999. These two faught in the ring, went through the crowd, and to the food stands. It was funny when they started to throw food at each other such as pizza, funnel cakes, coke and other drinks, and sugar. Al Snow wins when he powerbombed Holly through a table to retain the Hardcore title.3. Jeff Jarrett and Debra vs. Val Venis and Nicole Bass (Mixed Tag Team Match) 7/10This was not such a good match, especially since it came after Owen's death. This match was pretty short too. It was funny when Jeff started cussing at Nicole and earlier called her a he/she. Val and Nicole get the victory when he did the Money Shot on Jeff.4. Road Dogg vs. Billy Gunn 7/10This match was not that good either. It was actually pretty boring. It had a few good moves but it was not that good still. Billy Gunn wins with that finishing move he does.5. Big Boss Man, Bradshaw, Faarooq, and Viscera vs. Mankind, The Big Show, Ken Shamrock, and Test (Eight Man Survivor Series Elimiation Match) 8/10This match was pretty good. It was a little rushed but it had good moves in it. What made me mad was that most of the men got either counted-out or DQ. It was funny when the Big Boss Man cussed out Mankind. A good match.6. Triple H with Chyna vs. The Rock 8/10This was an okay match. This watch was bad when it is compared to some these two had in the future. This match was pretty rough with both men getting hurt bad, and Triple H bleeds. The ending sucks with The Rock winning by DQ.7. The Undertaker vs. Stone Cold Steve Austin 9/10This match good but also dissapointing. It was dissapointing because Steve Austin has a real big disadvantage. This was a real rough match with Shane McMahon, Pat Patterson, and Gerald Brisco all getting knocked out as referees, but the ending sucks so bad. It ends with Shane pushing Vince into Austin and they fall, and then the Undertaker gets on top of Austin with Shane doing a real fast three count. After the match Steve Austin beats up Corperate Ministry members such as Mideon and Big Boss Man and then you see the Undertaker walking out as the new WWE Champion with other Corperate members and Shane while Vince is on his knees by the commentators. Austin his really mad in the ring. A bad ending to a real tradgic night.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 1998 Over The EdgeMay 31, 1998Milwaukee ArenaMilwaukee, WisconsinL.O.D. 2000 V. Skull & 8-Ballok opener. Nothing too special. LOD wins. **1/2 I'm confused. L.O.D. 2000 didn't even make it the end of 1998. Oh well.Jeff Jarrett V. Steve BlackmanGood match. The King was great in this match by naming off some pretty funny country music sings. Like "If my nose were full of nickels I would blow them on you" Anyway, again, a good match. Double J wins. ***Marc Mero V. Sableum...Sable gets on top of Marc (Not that way you preverts) and the ref counts to two and then Mero reverses it and gets the three. Can anyone say "DUD"?Handicap Match:Kaientai V. Taka Michinka & BradshawDid you like where I put Bradshaw's name? After four little Japanese guys. That's great. Anyways, good match. NO! I said good match and it has Bradshaw in it. Damn! Well, it was good because of the moves that the four little Japanese guys did. Kaientai win. ***1/4WWF Intercontinental Championship:The Rock (Champion) V. FaarooqHorrible Intercontinental Title match. The wrestling was not crisp but sloppy. Stupid ending with The Rock winning out of no where with his legs getting to the ropes after the three count. *3/4Mask V. Mask Match:Kane V. Vaderok...what's the point of this match? You can already see Vader's face with the mask on. I remember this match being alot better than this. Not a very good match at all. Kane wins (DUH!) *1/2Six Man Tag Team Match:Triple H, Road Dogg, & Billy Gunn V. Owen Hart, D'Lo Brown, & KamaReally good tag team match. This match could have been great but it had something missing. The ending was great. Owen hits Triple H with the Pedigree onto one of the Tag belts and wins. Awesome finish. ***1/2WWF Championship:Stone Cold Steve Austin (Champion) V. Dude LoveAwesome match. Vince was the guest ref and it had that main event feel. Awesome match with an aweosme finish. Austin retains. ****1/2Overall, not that good of a show. Austin and Foley had a Match of the Year candidate and that's about it.
summary: What Really Makes This Event "Over The Edge"?
